title: 511. Why Did You Marry That Person?
description: Sure, you were “in love.” But economists — using evidence from Bridgerton to Tinder — point to what’s called “assortative mating.” And it has some unpleasant consequences for society.
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
content:encoded: Sure, you were “in love.” But economists — using evidence from Bridgerton to Tinder — point to what’s called “assortative mating.” And it has some unpleasant consequences for society.
